bibl.title: Letter from N. Paul Hudson to Emilie Lawrence Reed, November 5, 1936

div1.p: Hudson sends Emilie Lawrence Reed a program from the annual meeting of the American Society of Tropical Medicine. He invites her to attend the meeting, where she will be presented with the Walter Reed medal.

div1.head: Letter from N. Paul Hudson to Emilie Lawrence Reed, November 5, 1936
div1.opener:
HENRY E. MELENEY, PRESIDENT
NASHVILLE, TENN.
HERBERT C. CLARK, PRESIDENT-ELECT
PANAMA, R. de P.
ALFRED C. REED, VICE-PRESIDENT
SAN FRANCISCO, CAL.
CHARLES F. CRAIG, EDITOR
NEW ORLEANS, LA.
COUNCILORS:
T. B. MAGATH
S. S. COOK
E. B. McKINLEY
G. W. BACHMAN
L. L. WILLIAMS
M. F. BOYD
T. T. MACKIE
M. H. SOULE
THE AMERICAN SOCIETY
OF
TROPICAL MEDICINE
----
N. PAUL HUDSON, SECRETARY-TREASURER
DEPARTMENT OF BACTERIOLOGY
THE OHIO STATE UNIVERSITY
COLUMBUS, OHIO
November 5, 1936
Mrs. Walter Reed
The Burlington Hotel
Vermont Avenue at Thomas Circle
Washington, D. C.
My dear Mrs. Reed:
div1.p:
I am enclosing a printed program of the
American Society of Tropical Medicine in which you
will find a brief statement of the arrangements
made for the presentation of the Walter Reed Medal
to you.

Colonel Siler will make the presentation at
the luncheon of the Society in the Banquet Hall of
the Southern Hotel on Thursday, November 19. At
that time the Society would be pleased to receive you
as its guest and will be honored by your presence.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, N. Paul Hudson, M.D.
Secretary NPH:W
enc.
P.S. A copy of this letter is being sent to Blue Ridge
Summit, Pennsylvania, in case you may be residing there
at this time. N.P.H.
